title: Can a valid argument have false proposition? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. I’m assuming you understand that “proposition” can refer to either the conclusion or any premise. If the argument is valid, then the only restriction on truth is that if the conclusion is false, then at least one premise must also be false. If there is any way the conclusion could be false while all the premises were true, then by definition the argument is not valid.
